docs.snippet: The company, which acted at a sensitive time for China, said Guo Wengui had posted personal information that violated its terms of service.

headline.print_headline: Facebook Blocks Billionaire Known for Provoking China
headline.main: Facebook Blocks Chinese Billionaire Who Tells Tales of Corruption

docs.snippet: The web is not as open as it once was, with nation-states exerting their power over the internet. Facebook and other tech companies are dealing with the consequences.

headline.print_headline: Facebook Is Navigating a Global Power Struggle
headline.main: Facebook Faces a New World as Officials Rein In a Wild Web

docs.snippet: The social media giant owes it to its users to let them know if they interacted with what amounts to a digital spy. And that’s just the start.

headline.print_headline: Waiting for Facebook To Share More
headline.main: Facebook Knows More About Russia’s Election Meddling. Shouldn’t We?

docs.snippet: Google, Facebook and Twitter faced lawmakers’ ire in Washington this week. Facebook got the brunt of it, say Farhad Manjoo and Mike Isaac of The New York Times.

headline.print_headline: Farhad and Mike’s Week In Tech: Ads Under Fire
headline.main: Farhad and Mike’s Week in Tech: Facebook Under Fire in Washington

docs.snippet: Some of the measures Facebook has taken to fight the influence of fake news may not work all that well, research suggests.

headline.print_headline: Is Facebook’s Fact-Checking Effective? Researchers Offer Warnings
headline.main: Why the Fact-Checking at Facebook Needs to Be Checked

docs.snippet: As the social media giant grows in the developing world, its platform is being used to spread misinformation and incite violence.

headline.print_headline: Furor Abroad Is Far Darker For Facebook
headline.main: Forget Washington. Facebook’s Problems Abroad Are Far More Disturbing.

docs.snippet: The Chinese government does not allow its people to access Facebook, but it uses the network to influence opinion overseas.

headline.print_headline: Banned by China, but Used for Propaganda by It
headline.main: China Spreads Propaganda to U.S. on Facebook, a Platform It Bans at Home

docs.snippet: Is it really better to have restricted internet access than none at all?

headline.main: The More We Connect, the Better It Gets — for Facebook

docs.snippet: Parliament is asking social media giants about potential efforts by Moscow to sway voters, adding to inquiries in the United States and elsewhere.

headline.print_headline: Tech Giants Are Asked About Russia Tilting Brexit
headline.main: U.K. Lawmakers Ask Facebook About Russian Influence in Brexit Vote

docs.snippet: Here’s what you need to know at the end of the day.

headline.main: Congress, Jerusalem, Facebook: Your Thursday Evening Briefing
